parameters.definition: Amount of substance A in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance B in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance C in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance A in a container of Oil Max Pro
Amount of substance B in a container of Oil Max Pro
Amount of substance C in a container of Oil Max Pro
Total available amount of substance A
Total available amount of substance B
Total available amount of substance C
Profit per container of Oil Max
Profit per container of Oil Max Pro

description: A car manufacturer makes two types of car oils: Oil Max and Oil Max Pro. A container of Oil Max contains \param{AinMax} grams of substance A, \param{BinMax} grams of substance B and \param{CinMax} grams of substance C. A container of Oil Max Pro contains \param{AinMaxPro} grams of substance A, \param{BinMaxPro} grams of substance B and \param{CinMaxPro} grams of substance C. The car manufacturer has \param{TotalA} grams of substance A, \param{TotalB} grams of substance B, \param{TotalC} grams of substance C. In addition, the profit per container of Oil Max is $\param{ProfitMax} and the profit per container of Oil Max Pro is $\param{ProfitMaxPro}. How many containers of each type of oil should the car manufacturer make to maximize profit?
